009package imagingbook.common.regions;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
013
014import java.awt.Rectangle;
015import java.util.Formatter;
016import java.util.HashMap;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Locale;
019import java.util.Map;
020
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * This class represents a connected component or binary region. See Sec. 8.4 of
029 * [1] for additional details. Instances of this class support iteration over
030 * the contained pixel coordinates of type {@link Pnt2d}, e.g., by
031 * </p>
032 * <pre>
033 * import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
034 * 
035 * BinaryRegion R = ...;
036 * for (Pnt2d p : R) {
037 *    // process point p ...
038 * }
039 * </pre>
040 * <p>
041 * The advantage of providing iteration only is that it avoids the creation of
042 * (possibly large) arrays of pixel coordinates.
043 * </p>
044 * <p>
045 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
046 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
047 * </p>
048 * 
049 * @author WB
050 * @version 2020/12/21
051 */
052public abstract class BinaryRegion implements Comparable<BinaryRegion>, Iterable<Pnt2d> {
053        
054        // Constructor, to be used by package-local sub-classes only.
055        BinaryRegion() {
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * Returns the sum of the x-coordinates of the points
060         * contained in this region.
061         * @return the sum of x-values.
062         */
063        public abstract long getX1Sum();
064
065        /**
066         * Returns the sum of the y-coordinates of the points
067         * contained in this region.
068         * @return the sum of y-values.
069         */
070        public abstract long getY1Sum();
071
072        /**
073         * Returns the sum of the squared x-coordinates of the points
074         * contained in this region.
075         * @return the sum of squared x-values.
076         */
077        public abstract long getX2Sum();
078
079        /**
080         * Returns the sum of the squared y-coordinates of the points
081         * contained in this region.
082         * @return the sum of squared y-values.
083         */
084        public abstract long getY2Sum();
085
086        /**
087         * Returns the sum of the mixed x*y-coordinates of the points
088         * contained in this region.
089         * @return the sum of xy-values.
090         */
091        public abstract long getXYSum();
092        
093        /**
094         * Calculates and returns a vector of ordinary moments:
095         * (m10, m01, m20, m02, m11).
096         * @return vector of ordinary moments
097         */
098        public double[] getMoments() {
099                final int n = this.getSize();
100                if (n == 0) {
101                        throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, moments are undefined");
102                }
103                double m10 = getX1Sum() / (double) n;
104                double m01 = getY1Sum() / (double) n;
105                double m20 = getX2Sum() / (double) n;
106                double m02 = getY2Sum() / (double) n;
107                double m11 = getXYSum() / (double) n;
108                return new double[] {m10, m01, m20, m02, m11};
109        }
110
111        /**
112         * Calculates and returns a vector of central moments:
113         * (mu20, mu02, mu11).
114         * @return vector of central moments
115         */
116        public double[] getCentralMoments() {
117                final int n = this.getSize();
118                if (n == 0) {
119                        throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, moments are undefined");
120                }
121                double mu20 = getX2Sum() - getX1Sum() * getX1Sum() / (double) n;
122                double mu02 = getY2Sum() - getY1Sum() * getY1Sum() / (double) n;
123                double mu11 = getXYSum() - getX1Sum() * getY1Sum() / (double) n;
124                return new double[] {mu20, mu02, mu11};
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * <p>
129         * Returns the 2x2 covariance matrix for the pixel coordinates contained in this
130         * region: <br>
131         * | &sigma;<sub>20</sub> &sigma;<sub>11</sub> | <br>
132         * | &sigma;<sub>11</sub> &sigma;<sub>02</sub> |
133         * </p>
134         * 
135         * @return the covariance matrix
136         */
137        public double[][] getCovarianceMatrix() {
138                final int n = this.getSize();
139                double[] mu = getCentralMoments(); // = [mu20, mu02, mu11]
140                double[][] S = {
141                                {mu[0]/n, mu[2]/n},
142                                {mu[2]/n, mu[1]/n}};
143                return S;
144        }
145
146        /**
147         * Get the size of this region.
148         * @return the number of region points.
149         */
150        public abstract int getSize();
151
152        /**
153         * Get the x/y axes-parallel bounding box as a rectangle
154         * (including the extremal coordinates).
155         * @return the bounding box rectangle.
156         */
157        public abstract Rectangle getBoundingBox();
158
159
160        /**
161         * Returns the center of this region as a 2D point.
162         * @return the center point of this region.
163         */
164        public Pnt2d getCenter() {
165                final int n = this.getSize();
166                if (n == 0) {
167                        throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, center is undefined");
168                }
169                return PntDouble.from(((double)this.getX1Sum())/n, ((double)this.getY1Sum())/n);
170        }
171
172        /**
173         * <p>
174         * Calculates and returns this region's equivalent ellipse (see Sec. 8.6.3 of
175         * [1] for details).
176         * </p>
177         * <p>
178         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
179         * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
180         * </p>
181         * 
182         * @return the equivalent ellipse (instance of {@link GeometricEllipse})
183         */
184        public GeometricEllipse getEquivalentEllipse() {
185                final double n = this.getSize();
186                Pnt2d xc = this.getCenter();
187                double[] moments = this.getCentralMoments(); // = (mu20, mu02, mu11)
188                final double mu20 = moments[0];
189                final double mu02 = moments[1];
190                final double mu11 = moments[2];
191                
192                // direct calculation (without explicit Eigensolver): 
193                final double theta = 0.5 * Math.atan2(2 * mu11, mu20 - mu02);   // see [1], eq. 8.28
194                final double A = mu20 + mu02;
195                final double B = sqr(mu20 - mu02) + 4 * sqr(mu11);
196                if (B < 0) {
197                        throw new RuntimeException("negative B: " + B); // this should never happen
198                }               
199                final double a1 = A + sqrt(B);          // see [1], eq. 8.38
200                final double a2 = A - sqrt(B);
201                final double ra = sqrt(2 * a1 / n);     // see [1], eq. 8.40
202                final double rb = sqrt(2 * a2 / n);
203                
204                // same calculation using Eigensolver:
205//              Eigensolver2x2 solver = new Eigensolver2x2(mu20, mu11, mu11, mu02);
206//              double ra = 2 * Math.sqrt(solver.getRealEigenvalue(0) / n);
207//              double rb = 2 * Math.sqrt(solver.getRealEigenvalue(1) / n);
208//              double[] e0 = solver.getEigenvector(0).toArray();
209//              double theta = Math.atan2(e0[1], e0[0]);
210                
211                return new GeometricEllipse(ra, rb, xc.getX(), xc.getY(), theta);
212        }
213        
214        abstract void setOuterContour(Contour.Outer contr);
215
216        /**
217         * Returns the (single) outer contour of this region if available, null
218         * otherwise. Points on an outer contour are arranged in clockwise order.
219         * 
220         * @return the outer contour or {@code null} if not available
221         */
222        public abstract Contour getOuterContour();
223
224        /**
225         * Get all inner contours of this region if available, null otherwise. Points on
226         * inner contours are arranged in counter-clockwise order.
227         * 
228         * @return the (possibly empty) list of inner contours or {@code null} if not
229         *         available
230         */
231        public abstract List<Contour> getInnerContours();
232
233        // Compare method for sorting by region size (larger regions at front)
234        @Override
235        public int compareTo(BinaryRegion other) {
236                return Integer.compare(other.getSize(), this.getSize());
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Checks if the given pixel position is contained in this
241         * {@link BinaryRegion} instance.
242         * @param u x-coordinate
243         * @param v y-coordinate
244         * @return true if (u,v) is contained in this region
245         */
246        public abstract boolean contains(int u, int v);
247        
248        /**
249         * Checks if the given pixel position is contained in this
250         * {@link BinaryRegion} instance.
251         * @param p the pixel coordinate
252         * @return true if the position is contained in this region
253         */
254        public boolean contains (PntInt p) {
255                return this.contains(p.x, p.y);
256        }
257
258        // ------------------------------------------------------------
259        // ------------------------------------------------------------
260
261
262        /* Methods for attaching region properties dynamically.
263         * Properties can be used to hash results of region calculations
264         * to avoid multiple calculations.
265         * Currently, only 'double' values are supported.
266         * 
267         * E.g. calculate major axis angle theta for region r, then do
268         *    r.setProperty("angle", theta);
269         * and subsequently
270         *    double theta = r.getProperty("angle");
271         */
272        private Map<Object, Double> properties = null;
273
274        /**
275         * Sets the specified property of this region to the given value.
276         * @param key The key of the property.
277         * @param val The value associated with this property.
278         */
279        public void setProperty(Object key, double val) {
280                if (key == null) {
281                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("property key must not be null");
282                }
283                if (properties == null) {
284                        properties = new HashMap<>();
285                }
286                properties.put(key, val);
287        }
288
289        /**
290         * Retrieves the specified region property. 
291         * {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown if the property 
292         * is not defined for this region.
293         * 
294         * @param key The key of the property.
295         * @return The value associated with the specified property.
296         */
297        public double getProperty(Object key) {
298                if (key == null) {
299                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("property key must not be null");
300                }
301                Double value;
302                if (properties == null || (value = properties.get(key)) == null) {
303                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Region property " + key + " is undefined.");
304                }
305                return value.doubleValue();
306        }
307
308        /**
309         * Removes all properties attached to this region.
310         */
311        public void clearProperties() {
312                properties.clear();
313        }
314        
315        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
316        
317        @Override
318        public String toString() {
319                Pnt2d xc = this.getCenter();
320                try (Formatter fm = new Formatter(new StringBuilder(), Locale.US)) {
321                        fm.format("%s:", this.getClass().getSimpleName());
322                        fm.format(" area = %d", this.getSize());
323                        fm.format(", bounding box = %s", this.getBoundingBox());
324                        fm.format(", center = (%.2f, %.2f)", xc.getX(), xc.getY());
325        //              if (innerContours != null)
326        //                      fm.format(", holes = %d", innerContours.size());
327                        //String s = fm.toString();
328                        return fm.toString();
329                } //fm.close();
330                //return s;
331        }
332        
333
334}
